publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5792 Colin Fox: Congratulations to the Proclaimers on their First Number One Single—That the Parliament congratulates The Proclaimers, Craig and Charlie Reid, on reaching number one in the singles chart with the Comic Relief version of their song, I’m Gonna Be (500 Miles); recognises that this is the duo’s first number one and has been achieved with a song which has long had a special place in Scottish hearts and comes 19 years after the record was originally released, and welcomes the fact that the monies raised from sales of the single go towards good causes aimed at alleviating poverty and hardship at home and abroad.

S2M-5792 Congratulations to the Proclaimers on their First Number One Single (lodged on 27 March 2007) Rosie Kane*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Bruce Crawford*, Elaine Smith*, Eleanor Scott*, Alex Neil*, Tricia Marwick*, Chris Ballance*, John Scott*, Brian Adam*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Dave Petrie*
S2M-5792 Congratulations to the Proclaimers on their First Number One Single (lodged on 27 March 2007) Mr Brian Monteith*

S2M-5792 Colin Fox: Congratulations to the Proclaimers on their First Number One Single—That the Parliament congratulates The Proclaimers, Craig and Charlie Reid, on reaching number one in the singles chart with the Comic Relief version of their song, I’m Gonna Be (500 Miles); recognises that this is the duo’s first number one and has been achieved with a song which has long had a special place in Scottish hearts and comes 19 years after the record was originally released, and welcomes the fact that the monies raised from sales of the single go towards good causes aimed at alleviating poverty and hardship at home and abroad. Supported by: Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Mr Adam Ingram, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Bruce Crawford, Elaine Smith, Eleanor Scott, Alex Neil, Tricia Marwick, Chris Ballance, John Scott, Brian Adam, Ms Sandra White, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Roseanna Cunningham, Dave Petrie, Mr Brian Monteith, Ms Maureen Watt*

S2M-5792 Colin Fox: Congratulations to the Proclaimers on their First Number One Single—That the Parliament congratulates The Proclaimers, Craig and Charlie Reid, on reaching number one in the singles chart with the Comic Relief version of their song, I’m Gonna Be (500 Miles); recognises that this is the duo’s first number one and has been achieved with a song which has long had a special place in Scottish hearts and comes 19 years after the record was originally released, and welcomes the fact that the monies raised from sales of the single go towards good causes aimed at alleviating poverty and hardship at home and abroad. Supported by: Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Mr Adam Ingram, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Bruce Crawford, Elaine Smith, Eleanor Scott, Alex Neil, Tricia Marwick, Chris Ballance, John Scott, Brian Adam, Ms Sandra White, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Roseanna Cunningham, Dave Petrie, Mr Brian Monteith, Ms Maureen Watt
